attributes.description: Basic commands for interacting with the user
attributes.name: User Interaction

attributes.description: Beep 1 or more times
attributes.name: beep

attributes.description: number of times to beep
Choose an application on this machine or the network
attributes.name: choose application

attributes.description: the dialog window title
attributes.name: with title

attributes.description: the prompt to be displayed in the dialog box
attributes.name: with prompt

attributes.description: Allow multiple items to be selected? (default is false)
attributes.name: multiple selections allowed

attributes.description: the desired type of result. May be application (the default) or alias.
attributes.name: as

attributes.description: the chosen application
Choose a color
attributes.name: choose color

attributes.description: the default color
attributes.name: default color

attributes.description: the chosen color
Choose a file on a disk or server
attributes.name: choose file

attributes.description: the prompt to be displayed in the dialog box
attributes.name: with prompt

attributes.description: a list of file types or type identifiers. Only files of the specified types will be selectable.
attributes.name: of type

attributes.description: the default file location
attributes.name: default location

attributes.description: Show invisible files and folders? (default is false)
attributes.name: invisibles

attributes.description: Allow multiple items to be selected? (default is false)
attributes.name: multiple selections allowed

attributes.description: Show the contents of packages? (Packages will be treated as folders. Default is false.)
attributes.name: showing package contents

attributes.description: the chosen file

attributes.name: choose file name

attributes.description: the prompt to be displayed in the dialog box
attributes.name: with prompt

attributes.description: the default name for the new file
attributes.name: default name

attributes.description: the default file location
attributes.name: default location

attributes.description: the file the user specified

attributes.description: the prompt to be displayed in the dialog box
attributes.name: with prompt

attributes.description: the default folder location
attributes.name: default location

attributes.description: Show invisible files and folders? (default is false)
attributes.name: invisibles

attributes.description: Allow multiple items to be selected? (default is false)
attributes.name: multiple selections allowed

attributes.description: Show the contents of packages? (Packages will be treated as folders. Default is false.)
attributes.name: showing package contents

attributes.description: the chosen folder

attributes.name: choose from list

attributes.description: a list of items to display
the dialog window title

attributes.description: the prompt to be displayed in the dialog box
attributes.name: with prompt

attributes.description: a list of items to initially select (an empty list if no selection)
attributes.name: default items

attributes.description: the name of the OK button

attributes.description: the name of the Cancel button
attributes.name: cancel button name

attributes.description: Allow multiple items to be selected?
attributes.name: multiple selections allowed

attributes.name: empty selection allowed

attributes.description: the chosen application

attributes.name: editable URL

attributes.description: the chosen URL
Pause for a fixed amount of time
attributes.name: delay

attributes.description: the number of seconds to delay (default is 0)

children.text: NOTE: This is a built-in command, not a scripting addition, and is documented here for reference.

attributes.description: Display an alert
attributes.name: display alert

attributes.description: the alert text (will be displayed in emphasized system font)
the explanatory message (will be displayed in small system font)
attributes.name: message

attributes.description: the type of alert (default is informational)
attributes.name: as

attributes.description: a list of up to three button names
attributes.name: buttons

attributes.description: the name or number of the default button
attributes.name: default button

attributes.description: the name or number of the cancel button
attributes.name: cancel button

attributes.description: number of seconds to wait before automatically dismissing the alert
attributes.name: giving up after

attributes.description: a record containing the button clicked
Reply record for the ‘display alert’ command
attributes.name: alert reply

attributes.description: name of button chosen (empty if ‘giving up after’ was supplied and alert timed out)
attributes.name: button returned

attributes.description: Did the alert time out? (present only if ‘giving up after’ was supplied)
attributes.name: gave up

attributes.description: Display a dialog box, optionally requesting user input
attributes.name: display dialog

attributes.description: the text to display in the dialog box
the default editable text
attributes.name: default answer

attributes.description: Should editable text be displayed as bullets? (default is false)
attributes.name: hidden answer

attributes.description: a list of up to three button names
attributes.name: buttons

attributes.description: the name or number of the default button
attributes.name: default button

attributes.description: the name or number of the cancel button
attributes.name: cancel button

attributes.description: the dialog window title
attributes.name: with title

attributes.description: the resource name or ID of the icon to display…
attributes.name: with icon

attributes.description: …or one of these system icons…
attributes.name: with icon

attributes.description: …or an alias or file reference to a ‘.icns’ file
attributes.name: with icon

attributes.description: number of seconds to wait before automatically dismissing the dialog
attributes.name: giving up after

attributes.description: a record containing the button clicked and text entered (if any)
Reply record for the ‘display dialog’ command
attributes.name: dialog reply

attributes.description: name of button chosen (empty if ‘giving up after’ was supplied and dialog timed out)
attributes.name: button returned

attributes.description: text entered (present only if ‘default answer’ was supplied)
attributes.name: text returned

attributes.description: Did the dialog time out? (present only if ‘giving up after’ was supplied)
attributes.name: gave up

attributes.description: Display a notification. At least one of the body text and the title must be specified.
attributes.name: display notification

attributes.description: the body text of the notification
the title of the notification (default is the name of the calling application).
attributes.name: with title

attributes.description: the subtitle of the notification
attributes.name: subtitle

attributes.description: the name of the sound to play
attributes.name: sound name

attributes.description: Speak the given text
attributes.name: say

attributes.description: the text to speak, which can include intonation characters
the text to display in the feedback window (if different). Ignored unless Speech Recognition is on.
attributes.name: displaying

attributes.description: the voice to speak with. (Default is the system voice.)
attributes.name: using

attributes.description: the rate of speech in words per minute. Average human speech occurs at a rate of 180 to 220 words per minute. (Default depends on the voice used. If “using” is not given, the system speaking rate is the default.)
attributes.name: speaking rate

attributes.description: the base pitch frequency, a real number from 0 to 127. Values correspond to MIDI note values, where 60 is equal to middle C. Typical pitches range from around 30 to 40 for a low-pitched male voice to perhaps 55 to 65 for a high-pitched child’s voice.
attributes.name: pitch

attributes.description: the pitch modulation, a real number from 0 to 127. A value of 0 corresponds to a monotone in which all speech is at the base speech pitch. Given a pitch value of 46, a modulation of 2 means the widest range of pitches would be 44 to 48.
attributes.name: modulation

attributes.description: the volume, a real number from 0 to 1 (default is the system volume).
attributes.name: volume

attributes.description: stop any current speech before starting (default is false). When false, “say” waits for previous speech commands to complete before beginning to speak.
attributes.name: stopping current speech

attributes.description: wait for speech to complete before returning (default is true).
attributes.name: waiting until completion

attributes.description: the alias, file reference or path string of an AIFF file (existing or not) to contain the sound output.
attributes.name: saving to

children.text: When “saving to” or voice-modifying parameters other than “using” are given, text is not displayed in the Speech Recognition feedback window, as it is not used to produce the speech in that case.

attributes.description: Useful commands for working with text

attributes.description: the code point of the specified character
the character

children.text: This command is deprecated; use ‘character id …’.

attributes.description: Convert a character to a number
attributes.name: ASCII number

attributes.description: the character
the code point of the specified character
Return the localized string for the specified key
attributes.name: localized string

attributes.description: the key
the name of the strings file excluding the “.strings” suffix (default is “Localizable”)
attributes.name: from table

attributes.description: an alias or file reference to the bundle containing the strings file (default is the current application/script bundle)
attributes.name: in bundle

attributes.description: the localized string
Find one piece of text inside another
attributes.name: offset

attributes.description: the source text to find the position of
attributes.name: of

attributes.description: the target text to search in
attributes.name: in

attributes.description: the position of the source text in the target, or 0 if not found
Summarize the specified text or text file
attributes.name: summarize

attributes.description: the text (or an alias to a text file) to summarize
the number of sentences desired in the summary
attributes.name: in

attributes.description: a summarized version of the text or file
Access to the Clipboard in applications
attributes.name: Clipboard Commands

attributes.description: Place data on an application’s clipboard. Use inside a ‘tell’ block and activate the application first
attributes.name: set the clipboard to

attributes.description: the data to place on the clipboard
Return the contents of an application’s clipboard. Use in a ‘tell’ block after activating the application
attributes.name: the clipboard

attributes.description: the type of data desired
attributes.name: as

attributes.description: the data
Return information about the clipboard
attributes.name: clipboard info

attributes.description: restricts to information about only this data type
attributes.name: for

attributes.description: a list of {data type, size} for each type of data on the clipboard
Commands for reading and writing information in a file
attributes.name: File Read/Write

attributes.description: Open a disk file for the read and write commands
attributes.name: open for access

attributes.description: the file or alias to open for access. If the file does not exist, a new file is created.
whether to allow writing to the file.
attributes.name: write permission

attributes.description: a file reference number; use for ‘read’, ‘write’, and ‘close access’
Close a file that was opened for access
attributes.name: close access

attributes.description: the file reference number, alias, or file reference of the file to close
Read data from a file that has been opened for access
attributes.name: read

attributes.description: the file reference number, alias, or file reference of the file to read
starting from this position; if omitted, start at last position read from
attributes.name: from

attributes.description: the number of bytes to read from current position; if omitted, read until the end of the file…
attributes.name: for

attributes.description: …or stop at this position…
attributes.name: to

attributes.description: …or read up to but not including this character…
attributes.name: before

attributes.description: …or read up to and including this character
attributes.name: until

attributes.description: the value that separates items to read…
attributes.name: using delimiter

attributes.description: …or a list of values that separate items to read
attributes.name: using delimiters

attributes.description: the form in which to read and return data
attributes.name: as

attributes.description: the data read from the file
Write data to a file that was opened for access with write permission
attributes.name: write

attributes.description: the data to write to the file
the file reference number, alias, or file reference of the file to write to
attributes.name: to

attributes.description: start writing at this position in the file
attributes.name: starting at

attributes.description: the number of bytes to write; if not specified, write all the data provided
attributes.name: for

attributes.description: how to write the data: as text, data, list, etc.
attributes.name: as

attributes.description: Return the length, in bytes, of a file
attributes.name: get eof

attributes.description: a file reference number, alias, or file reference of a file
the total number of bytes in the file
Set the length, in bytes, of a file
attributes.name: set eof

attributes.description: a file reference number, alias, or file reference of a file
the new length of the file, in bytes. Any data beyond this position is lost.
attributes.name: to

attributes.description: short integers
attributes.name: short

attributes.description: end of file
attributes.name: eof

attributes.description: Commands to work with scripts
attributes.name: Scripting Commands

attributes.description: Return a script object loaded from a specified file

the script object. You can get this object’s properties or call its handlers as if it were a local script object.
Store a script object into a file

attributes.description: the script object to store
an alias or file reference to the file to store the script object in
attributes.name: in

attributes.description: control display of the Save As dialog
attributes.name: replacing

attributes.description: Run a specified script or script file
attributes.name: run script

a list of parameters
attributes.name: with parameters

attributes.description: the scripting component to use; default is the current scripting component
attributes.name: in

attributes.description: the result of running the script
Return a list of all scripting components (e.g. AppleScript)
attributes.name: scripting components

attributes.description: a list of installed scripting components
display save as dialog
attributes.name: ask

attributes.description: overwrite existing file
attributes.name: yes

attributes.description: don't overwrite existing file
attributes.name: no

attributes.description: Other useful commands
attributes.name: Miscellaneous Commands

attributes.description: Return the current date and time
attributes.name: current date

attributes.description: the current date and time. Use ‘month of (current date)’, etc. to get individual parts.
Execute a shell script using the ‘sh’ shell
attributes.name: do shell script

attributes.description: the shell script to execute.
the desired type of result; default is text (UTF-8)
attributes.name: as

attributes.description: execute the command as the administrator
attributes.name: administrator privileges

attributes.description: use this administrator account to avoid a password dialog (If this parameter is specified, the “password” parameter must also be specified.)
attributes.name: user name

attributes.description: use this administrator password to avoid a password dialog
attributes.name: password

attributes.description: the prompt to be displayed in the password dialog when the name and password are not specified or are incorrect
attributes.name: with prompt

attributes.description: change all line endings to Mac-style and trim a trailing one (default true)
attributes.name: altering line endings

attributes.description: the command output

children.text: For answers to commonly asked questions about do shell script, see Technical Note TN2065.

attributes.description: Get the sound output and input volume settings
attributes.name: get volume settings

attributes.description: a record containing the sound output and input volume settings
Reply record for the ‘get volume settings’ command
attributes.name: volume settings

attributes.description: the sound output volume
attributes.name: output volume

attributes.description: the sound input volume
attributes.name: input volume

attributes.description: the alert volume (as a percentage of the output volume)
attributes.name: alert volume

attributes.description: Is the sound output muted?
attributes.name: output muted

attributes.description: Generate a random number
attributes.name: random number

attributes.description: the upper limit (Default is 1.0. If this parameter is specified, the “from” and “to” parameters will be ignored.)
the lowest number to return (default is 0.0)
attributes.name: from

attributes.description: the highest number to return (default is 1.0)
attributes.name: to

attributes.description: a starting point for a repeatable sequence of random numbers. A value of 0 will use a random seed.
attributes.name: with seed

attributes.description: a number between the “from” and “to” limits, including limit values. If all specified limits are integers, the result is an integer. Otherwise, the result is a real.
Round number to integer
attributes.name: round

attributes.description: the number to round

the rounding direction; if omitted, rounds to nearest. “to nearest” rounds .5 cases to the nearest even integer in order to decrease cumulative errors. To always round .5 away from zero, use “as taught in school.”
attributes.name: rounding

attributes.description: the rounded value
Set the sound output and/or input volume
attributes.name: set volume

attributes.description: the sound output volume, a real number from 0 to 7 (This parameter is deprecated; if specified, all other parameters will be ignored.)
the sound output volume, an integer from 0 to 100
attributes.name: output volume

attributes.description: the sound input volume, an integer from 0 to 100
attributes.name: input volume

attributes.description: the alert volume, an integer from 0 to 100
attributes.name: alert volume

attributes.description: Should the sound output be muted?
attributes.name: output muted
